predicate.note: Frames file for 'reverberate' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 47.4.

example.name: inchoative
example.text: ``The aftershocks of Oct. 13 (when the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 190 points) are still reverberating.''
example.arg: The aftershocks of Oct. 13 (when the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 190 points)

example.name: often with location
example.text: The disarray in the junk-bond market that began last month with a credit crunch at Campeau Corp. and the failure of banks to deliver financing for a leveraged buy-out of United Airlines parent UAL Corp. has reverberated through some of the nation's largest law firms.
example.arg: The disarray in the junk-bond market that began last month with a credit crunch at Campeau Corp. and the failure of banks to deliver financing for a leveraged buy-out of United Airlines parent UAL Corp.
through some of the nation's largest law firms
